title: Beam Detection Based on Machine Learning Algorithms. (arXiv:2308.00718v1 [physics.data-an])
abstract: The positions of free electron laser beams on screens are precisely determined by a sequence of machine learning models. Transfer training is conducted in a self-constructed convolutional neural network based on VGG16 model. Output of intermediate layers are passed as features to a support vector regression model. With this sequence, 85.8% correct prediction is achieved on test data.
context:
Title: Beam Detection Based on Machine Learning Algorithms. (arXiv:2308.00718v1 [physics.data-an])
Abstract: The positions of free electron laser beams on screens are precisely determined by a sequence of machine learning models. Transfer training is conducted in a self-constructed convolutional neural network based on VGG16 model. Output of intermediate layers are passed as features to a support vector regression model. With this sequence, 85.8% correct prediction is achieved on test data.
translated_title: 基于机器学习算法的光束检测
translated_abstract: 通过一系列机器学习模型精确确定自由电子激光束在屏幕上的位置。在基于VGG16模型的自建卷积神经网络中进行迁移训练。将中间层的输出作为特征传递给支持向量回归模型。通过这个序列，在测试数据上实现了85.8％的正确预测。
tldr: 本文介绍了一种基于机器学习算法的光束检测方法，通过自建卷积神经网络和支持向量回归模型的组合进行预测，成功实现了85.8%的准确率。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a beam detection method based on machine learning algorithms, which combines a self-constructed convolutional neural network and a support vector regression model to achieve a prediction accuracy of 85.8%.
